title: Reelected European Commission President von der Leyen keeps act II of Green Pact to bare minimum
summary: Reappointed for a second term on Thursday, the European Commission President focused on defending the industrial aspect of the Green Deal.

title: Macron-supported candidate re-elected as Assemblée Nationale president
summary: Yaël Braun-Pivet was reelected with 220 votes. In 2022, she became the first woman to be elected to this position.

title: Biden nears crunch point as pressure grows to drop out
summary: The 81-year-old Democrat is holed up at his beach house with Covid as multiple US media reports said he was considering the future of his reelection bid amid mounting opposition within his party.

title: Boeing workers vote to authorize a massive strike
summary: The IAM District 751 union is calling for a pay increase of at least 40% over three years.

title: Elbridge Colby, former US deputy secretary of defense: 'We don't want to be the world's policeman'
summary: Elbridge Colby, a Republican specialist in foreign affairs, told Le Monde that Europe needs to 'step up' when it comes to autonomy and defense.

title: In the Donbas, an invisible gulf between the Ukrainian military and civilians accused of 'waiting for Russia'
summary: The small fringe of people still living under the bombs is arousing the suspicion of the Ukrainian military. Are they afraid to leave their homes, or are they spies for the enemy?

title: Man shot dead by police after knifing officer in Paris near Champs-Elysées
summary: An attacker in Paris' luxurious Champs-Elysée neighborhood tried to enter a Louis Vuitton store before being turned away. Holding a knife, he injured a police officer who had been called to secure the store, according to the interior minister.

title: Hunter Biden seeks dismissal of tax and gun cases, citing decision to toss Trump's classified documents case
summary: In a pair of filings Thursday, lawyers for President Biden's son said the same logic should apply in his cases. They have asked for the dismissal of a pending tax prosecution in Los Angeles and a separate firearm case in Delaware, in which Hunter Biden was convicted of three felony charges.

title: Central Paris locks down for Olympics as athletes arrive
summary: French security forces began locking down large parts of the capital ahead of the hugely complex Olympics opening ceremony next week on the Seine.

title: US federal appeals court blocks remainder of Biden's student debt relief plan
summary: In a ruling Thursday, the 8th Circuit Court of Appeals granted a motion for an administrative stay filed by a group of Republican-led states seeking to invalidate the administration's entire student loan forgiveness program.

title: Car crashing into Paris cafe 'could have been intentional,' prosecutor says
summary: The incident took place on Wednesday on the terrace of the Le Ramus bar near the Père-Lachaise cemetery. One person died and six were injured, three of them seriously, according to the prosecutor's office. The 24-year-old driver was taken to a psychiatric hospital.

title: Women come forward to accuse famous French priest of sexual assault
summary: A report commissioned by charities Abbé Pierre founded reveals a pattern of sexual assault committed by the priest from the late 1970s to 2005.

title: Luxury brands and private investors take over the Champs-Elysées
summary: Ambitious real estate projects are on the rise up and down the famous avenue, with LVMH leading the charge. These companies want to make their mark on the street by funding an urban redevelopment plan.

title: J.D. Vance pushes his working-class roots in first speech as Trump's running mate
summary: The 39-year-old senator also attacked President Biden's policies at the convention in Milwaukee on Wednesday.

title: Tour de France: Campenaerts wins stage 18, Pogacar retains lead
summary: Victor Campanaerts of Lotto Dstny won the Tour de France active, hilly stage 18.

title: Our selection of five youth hostels in Paris
summary: Here are five hip and friendly places to stay in Paris on a budget.

title: A glossary to understand the situation in French Parliament and government
summary: France's snap elections have brought some procedural or technical terms back to the forefront: Parliamentary groups, presidency of the Assemblée, caretaker government... Le Monde explains them.

title: France hunts arson suspect after Nice fire kills 7
summary: Rescuers were alerted to the blaze that killed four people on the seventh floor of a building in the low-income neighborhood of Les Moulins in the southern French city.

title: Ursula von der Leyen elected for second term as European Commission president
summary: The German ex-defense minister, who became the first woman leader of the European Commission in 2019, had earlier on Thursday presented herself as the best and most experienced captain to steer the commission.

title: Across India, infrastructure is collapsing one after the other
summary: Several airports and bridges have collapsed, mainly due to rainfall, while the country is building at breakneck speed to maintain its development.

title: Paris 2024: Behind the scenes of the International Broadcast Center, the Olympics' media and technical heart
summary: The International Broadcast Center at the Le Bourget Exhibition Center will host between 8,000 and 10,000 journalists every day. All images and sound from the competition will transit through this highly secure site.

title: Israeli army investigates aerial attack after Tel Aviv explosion kills one and injures several
summary: The blast was 'caused by the falling of an aerial target', according to an initial inquiry, the Israeli army said on Friday.

title: Le Monde and the Olympics, an irresistible combination
summary: In 1948, at the Winter Olympics held in Saint-Moritz, Switzerland, the management of Le Monde agreed to send one journalist to cover the events. In 2024, in Paris, the event has become a must for the newspaper, and nearly a hundred of its journalists are involved.

title: Trump, in highly personal speech, accepts GOP nomination days after assassination attempt
summary: The former president began his acceptance speech with a personal message that drew directly from his brush with death. Later, he outlined his priorities on immigration and the economy but also referenced false theories of election fraud and promised to expand oil drilling.

title: 'Asylum requests have slowed over the first half of 2024 in France'
summary: France is on a par with the rest of Europe in terms of the number of asylum applications it receives relative to the size of its population. Le Monde spoke with Julien Boucher, director of the French Office for the Protection of Refugees, about France's record on immigration.

title: Bangladesh: Widespread internet outages after unrest
summary: Fresh clashes broke out in several cities across Bangladesh on Thursday as protesters demand a reform of civil service hiring rules.

title: Protesters set fire to government buildings in Bangladesh
summary: At the heart of the week's protests that have left at least 39 dead was the quota system for civil service jobs. The students are calling on the government to put an end to this system and are demanding a merit-based system.

title: Large-scale IT outage affects airports worldwide, disrupts many industries
summary: A major outage wrought havoc on global computer systems on Friday, grounding flights, derailing television broadcasts and impacting telecommunications.

title: Where to sleep in Paris? Le Monde's top 25 addresses
summary: On vacation in the capital or in the Paris region? Here is our selection of hotels and hostels in interactive map format.

title: Project 2025, the conservative revolution disrupting Trump's forward march
summary: Democrats are denouncing the liberticidal and extremist aims of the roadmap concocted by experts close to the ex-president. Trump is distancing himself from the project, even though it involves many figures from his former administration.

title: French left's failure to secure presidency of Assemblée is additional obstacle on road to power
summary: The left-wing alliance's candidate, Communist André Chassaigne, lost to Yaël Braun-Pivet, who was re-elected thanks to the votes of the presidential camp and the right – a pattern that could be repeated with the post of prime minister.

title: Starmer and Macron make first move to 'restore relations' between London, Paris and the EU
summary: Two weeks after his victory over the Tories, the new head of the British government took his first steps on the international stage by hosting the fourth summit of the European Political Community on Thursday.

title: Anti-left front emerges as Macron-backed candidate re-elected as Assemblée Nationale president
summary: Yaël Braun-Pivet, president of the Assemblée Nationale, was re-elected on Thursday against left-wing candidate André Chassaigne and far-right candidate Sébastien Chenu. She called for 'new methods'... just as she did in 2022.

title: Vietnamese Communist Party leader Nguyen Phu Trong  dies aged 80
summary: The head of Vietnam's governing Communist Party died on Friday 'after a period of illness' that forced him to step back from duties in recent days.

title: Russian court sentences US reporter Evan Gershkovich to 16 years in jail
summary: The Wall Street Journal reporter was found guilty of spying on Friday, in a trial that his employer and the US have rejected as a sham.

title: Paris knife attacker suspected of killing teenager
summary: A policeman was wounded with a knife on Thursday near the Champs-Elysées. According to police sources, the attacker, who was shot dead by a policeman, is suspected of having committed a murder in a Paris suburb on the same day.

title: City of Paris takes legal action against 'flying taxis' during Olympic Games
summary: The city, alongside other organizations, is challenging the French government's authorization of a helicopter taxi project, calling it 'an environmental aberration for the ultra-rich'.

title: Israel's occupation of Palestinian territory is 'illegal' according to top UN court
summary: The International Court of Justice's legal opinions are not binding, but they do carry considerable political weight.

title: Houthis claim responsibility for drone strike that left one dead in Tel Aviv
summary: The device penetrated Israeli defenses without triggering warning sirens. The Yemeni rebels are acting in solidarity with Hamas as part of the Iranian-led 'axis of resistance.'

title: Who is Yaël Braun-Privet, the re-elected president of France's Assemblée Nationale?
summary: The member of French President Emmanuel Macron's Rennaissance party, a lawyer in her pre-political life, was re-elected on Thursday.

title: Democratic voters in Arizona divided over Biden's presidential bid
summary: While many political leaders, including Barack Obama, have expressed doubts about the viability of a Joe Biden candidacy, Democrat supporters on the ground seem more divided.

title: Paris 2024: QR codes and anti-terror zones transform city center
summary: From July 18, traffic around the Seine in central Paris, the site of the Olympic Games opening ceremony on July 26, is being significantly restricted.

title: Global IT outage: What we know so far
summary: A global tech outage is creating challenges for hospitals, airports, and banks across the world after a faulty update triggered a massive bug on Microsoft-run Windows computers on Friday.

title: Adidas drops Bella Hadid from campaign over Gaza controversy
summary: Adidas dropped vocal pro-Palestinian model Bella Hadid from an advertising campaign for vintage Olympics-inspired sneakers.

title: Paris 2024: City's homeless 'made invisible' after camp evictions
summary: Authorities have denied that camp closures are linked to the Olympics, but a collective of homeless organizations have expressed disappointment when it comes to the promise of a 'social legacy' from the Games.

title: Pogacar wins 19th stage to close on Tour de France triumph
summary: Tadej Pogacar overtook three riders on the final 16-kilometer climb to win the nineteenth stage of the Tour de France on Friday.

title: Megabasins: What's the latest in the water reservoir rush?
summary: The outgoing French government has shown its willingness to develop agricultural hydraulics. But courts have frequently overturned prefectures' water withdrawal authorizations.

title: Bangladesh imposes curfew, calls in military after deadly unrest
summary: Bangladesh announced the imposition of a curfew and the deployment of military forces on Friday after police failed to quell days of deadly unrest that has spread throughout the country.

title: Worldwide computer breakdown: airports, banks and hospitals disrupted by the biggest computer failure in history
summary: A software update from CrowdStrike, affecting Microsoft Windows computers, caused havoc for businesses across the world.

title: Macron keeps promise to swim in Seine, but 'not necessarily' before Paris Olympics
summary: A spokesperson for President Macron asserted to reporters on Friday, July 19, that Macron has consistently expressed this conviction, though he may not find the opportunity to do so before the Games' opening ceremony due to scheduling constraints.

title: Tunisian President Kais Saied announces bid for reelection amidst turbulent first term
summary: The birthplace of the 'Arab Spring' has become, under Saied's presidency, the scene of an authoritarian toughening, raising fears of a return to dictatorial practices.

title: US to phase out federal usage of single-use plastics by 2035
summary: The World Wildlife Fund has warned that unless governments reach an ambitious agreement with legally binding rules, global plastic pollution is set to triple by 2040.
